emerges from the house -- wearing a dark Gianni Versace sport coat with a black vest underneath, carrying some kind of case in his hand. He looks great -- a man of action, not dandified at all by the snappy attire. He squints down toward Sonny, proudly -- very much the family man.

bolts back up the wharf, toward his car.

his badge. Suddenly Storm grabs the cop with the badge in front of his face and uses him as a human battering ram for him and Andy to escape, plunging the man through two layers of glass windows of the adjoining Hertz rental office and out into the street in front of the hotel!
from the roof of the next-to-last car roof in a line of parked vehicles soars through the air like a night eagle-

swiftly sliding through the shadows, he moves around the perimeter, pausing to examine things, searching for something. He finds an old storm gate to what would probably be a cellar or basement.

Seeing the doors open on both cars. A mature man, CALABRESE, and his stocky confederate, VITALE, step from the limo. TWO other MEN -- one wearing a stylish hat, the other bareheaded -- step from the wagon. They cross to the shadowed, shack area.
veers toward an upcoming exit ramp.

-- Murder is a serious business, my friend. And an expensive one.

steps forward into the light. His face comes clearly into view. Well dressed, magnetic, Bobby Kennedy-ish --

knew Storm from when I was City Attorney ... and he was a young homicide detective -

will sound completely absurd to you.

Storm gave me his word that he is innocent of all charges preferred against him in the press -- and that he has access to indisputable proof of this. Battling the atrophy caused by seven years of hospitalization, Storm is struggling even now to regain the strength that will enable him to come forward with this evidence. He has promised me and the K.A.B.C. audience a first look at his alleged proof.
O'Malley?   There's no O'Malley here.
A check?

Andy opens the door, reaches in for her jacket.   Suddenly she pauses.
In the light from the road lamp, we read the names: FELICIA STORM... MASON STORM ... JEREMY "SONNY" STORM.
You looking for Martha Coe?
You haven't seen the news?
She's dead. They shot her in the back... over in Westwood.

appear running down the drive -- SHOTGUN and assault RIFLE trained on Storm and Andy. They begin to FIRE.
Captain Holland! -- in the car as a passenger, with another plainclothes cop. The flying gate sends glass in all directions, as Storm swerves in his Jeep to avoid the car.
Striding swiftly. Toward Sonny. Their dark plainclothes suits in grim contrast to the colorful soccer uniforms --
The soccer coach turns back. We see him shout, his arm raised in a gesture of urgency --
-- Gee, my husband and I aren't really thinking about selling. In fact, we're adding a nursery --

Just checking for termites He tucks the camera case under his arm --
arrive from the living room. The Housewife stares in shock at this strange man -- with his hand halfway through her new wall.
moves into Storm's peripheral vision. Coat over his arm, concealing a short-barreled automatic weapon.
Someone wants to talk to you, Storm.
Twenty feet away -- both hands up -- holding a bay's athletic shirt... "TRINITY VENTURA."
Storm: stunned.

Storm seems to drift off somewhere far away, and then violently slams Trent up against the wall, pinning his chest with the left hand. Storm takes the sawed-off shotgun by the handle and punches the barrel straight into Trent's mouth. The barrel simply goes through the teeth and in his mouth. It appears Storm has made up his mind about what to do. Trent's eyes bug out of his head.

cursing and unable to gain ground on the fleet-footed --

in the mesh ceiling of the room. Sonny flops onto his back atop the tall equipment box, kicks up hard -- the hatch pops open!
pulls out after it.

dispersed at angles across from the message desk.

on foot, catch up to the scene.    Too late.

Holland enters the area and finds no one.     Now the look on his face is one of fear and confusion.
Holland as he   moves toward the sporting room   and his support team.    He enters the area of carnage   and the smug confidence on   his face starts to change to a   slight worry.
A Louis XIII portrait -- where a silver dollar-sized group of holes has just appeared, two inches above Holland's head. They are both out of ammo.
Storm enters and begins pushing the clothes of the racks aside -- looking for something that's probably not there.
steers it, standing up. Andy and Sonny in the back cockpit seat.
drifts its happy way across the sun-shimmering sea.
